author: Special Correspondent
text:
The striking government employees have decided to intensify their ongoing agitation to press 20 point charter of demands.

A meeting of the Tamil Nadu Arasu Oozhiar Sangam and All Government Department Unions Agitation Committee was held in the city on Saturday evening, when a decision to this effect was taken.

Good response

Appar, State vice-president of the Sangam, said that the demonstration and the picketing agitation organised to highlight the demands in the last three days evoked good response.

It had been planned to organise relay picketing agitation from Monday.

The teachers affiliated to the Tamil Nadu Arasu Aramba Palli Aasiriyar Koottamaippu will also join the agitation on Monday.

Grievances

The State Government had not cared to invite the union leaders for negotiations for solving the grievances in the last four years, he said and warned that the agitation would continue till the demands were met.

Rajkumar, district president of the Union, presided.

The representatives of Cooperation Department Employees Union, Silk Development Department Employees Union, Rural Development Department Employees Association and other associations participated in the meeting.
title: Striking government employees decide to intensify agitation
